p: Chemically, most of the essential oils are mixtures of hydrocarbon compounds (C5H8)n with their oxygenated, hydrogenated and dehydrogenated derivatives and most of them are monoterpenoids and sesquiterpenoids. There are about 3000 species of plants containing essential oils, from which 10 % are commercially important and used in perfumes, cosmetics and medicines or used as food and drugs preservatives and flavoring agents [3–6].
